Moby Dick.author: Herman Melville
Moby Dick.description: A thrilling tale of adventure and obsession as Captain Ahab pursues the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.

Sapiens.author: Yuval Noah Harari
Sapiens.description: A thought-provoking exploration of human history, covering topics from the rise of Homo sapiens to modern civilization.

1984.author: George Orwell
1984.description: A dystopian novel that delves into themes of totalitarianism, surveillance, and individuality in a controlled society.

The Selfish Gene.author: Richard Dawkins
The Selfish Gene.description: A groundbreaking work in evolutionary biology that introduces the concept of genes as the primary drivers of evolution.

Atomic Habits.author: James Clear
Atomic Habits.description: A guide on building good habits and breaking bad ones, with practical strategies for achieving long-term personal growth.

The Silent Patient.author: Alex Michaelides
The Silent Patient.description: A suspenseful psychological thriller about a woman who becomes mute after a traumatic incident and the therapist determined to uncover her story.

Educated.author: Tara Westover
Educated.description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho and her journey to self-education and freedom.

The Night Circus.author: Erin Morgenstern
The Night Circus.description: A magical tale of a traveling circus that appears without warning and the two magicians who are bound in a mysterious competition.

Where the Crawdads Sing.author: Delia Owens
Where the Crawdads Sing.description: A coming-of-age murder mystery set in the marshlands of North Carolina, exploring themes of loneliness, nature, and resilience.

Becoming.author: Michelle Obama
Becoming.description: The memoir of former First Lady Michelle Obama, sharing her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House.

The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck.author: Mark Manson
The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck.description: A refreshing take on self-help that emphasizes accepting life’s struggles and focusing on what truly matters.

The Great Alone.author: Kristin Hannah
The Great Alone.description: A story of survival and resilience set in the harsh wilderness of Alaska, following a family’s struggle and redemption.

Little Fires Everywhere.author: Celeste Ng
Little Fires Everywhere.description: A compelling story of family secrets and the clash between privilege and social justice in suburban America.

Circe.author: Madeline Miller
Circe.description: A reimagining of the life of Circe, the Greek mythological figure, blending magic and mythology into a captivating tale.

The Vanishing Half.author: Brit Bennett
The Vanishing Half.description: A multigenerational family saga that explores race, identity, and the influence of the past on the present.

Normal People.author: Sally Rooney
Normal People.description: A novel about two young people whose complex relationship is marked by love, friendship, and miscommunication.

It Ends with Us.author: Colleen Hoover
It Ends with Us.description: A romance novel that explores themes of love, abuse, and resilience, focusing on a young woman’s choices and sacrifices.

The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo.description: A glamorous and scandalous story of an aging Hollywood starlet recounting her life and seven marriages.

A Man Called Ove.author: Fredrik Backman
A Man Called Ove.description: A heartwarming tale of an old curmudgeon whose life is changed by the unexpected friendship of his quirky neighbors.

The Girl on the Train.author: Paula Hawkins
The Girl on the Train.description: A psychological thriller about a woman who witnesses something shocking during her daily train ride and becomes entangled in a mystery.

The Testaments.author: Margaret Atwood
The Testaments.description: A powerful sequel to 'The Handmaid's Tale' that explores the themes of resistance, power, and survival.

The Goldfinch.author: Donna Tartt
The Goldfinch.description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that follows a young boy whose life is transformed by a tragic event and a stolen painting.

The Tattooist of Auschwitz.author: Heather Morris
The Tattooist of Auschwitz.description: A love story set in the Holocaust, depicting the life of a tattooist in Auschwitz and the courage of those who endured.

The Book Thief.author: Markus Zusak
The Book Thief.description: A moving story of a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace in stealing books and sharing them with others.

The Handmaid's Tale.author: Margaret Atwood
The Handmaid's Tale.description: A dystopian novel that explores a future society where women are subjugated and valued only for their fertility.

Dune.author: Frank Herbert
Dune.description: A science fiction epic about a young man’s journey to control the desert planet Arrakis and its valuable spice.

Pachinko.author: Min Jin Lee
Pachinko.description: An epic family saga following four generations of a Korean family living in Japan and dealing with identity and resilience.

The Road.author: Cormac McCarthy
The Road.description: A bleak yet powerful tale of a father and son journeying through a post-apocalyptic world, facing hardships and moral choices.

Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.author: J.K. Rowling
Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.description: The beginning of the magical adventures of Harry Potter, a young wizard discovering his powers and facing challenges at Hogwarts.

The Catcher in the Rye.author: J.D. Salinger
The Catcher in the Rye.description: A classic novel about teenage rebellion and identity, following the journey of Holden Caulfield in New York City.

To Kill a Mockingbird.author: Harper Lee
To Kill a Mockingbird.description: A deeply moving novel that explores racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

The Alchemist.author: Paulo Coelho
The Alchemist.description: A spiritual journey of a shepherd boy searching for his personal legend and the meaning of life.

The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.author: Douglas Adams
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.description: A humorous science fiction story that takes readers on a wild adventure through space with an unlikely crew of travelers.

Good Omens.author: Neil Gaiman
Good Omens.description: A humorous story of an angel and demon teaming up to prevent the apocalypse, written by two masters of fantasy.

The Name of the Wind.author: Patrick Rothfuss
The Name of the Wind.description: The tale of a young man’s journey from poverty to legend, filled with magic, music, and intrigue.

Twilight.author: Stephenie Meyer
Twilight.description: A vampire romance novel that tells the story of Bella and Edward's forbidden love.

The Hunger Games.author: Suzanne Collins
The Hunger Games.description: In a dystopian future, teens are forced to compete in a televised death match in a fight for survival and freedom.

The Lightning Thief.author: Rick Riordan
The Lightning Thief.description: Percy Jackson, a young demigod, discovers his true identity and embarks on a quest to prevent a war among gods.

Life of Pi.author: Yann Martel
Life of Pi.description: A philosophical adventure about a boy stranded at sea with a Bengal tiger, exploring survival and spirituality.

Fahrenheit 451.author: Ray Bradbury
Fahrenheit 451.description: A classic dystopian novel where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them to suppress independent thought.

The Lovely Bones.author: Alice Sebold
The Lovely Bones.description: A haunting story of a young girl watching over her family from the afterlife after she becomes a murder victim.

Ender's Game.author: Orson Scott Card
Ender's Game.description: A young boy is trained through simulated warfare to lead humanity against an alien threat in this sci-fi classic.

The Pillars of the Earth.author: Ken Follett
The Pillars of the Earth.description: An epic saga centered on the construction of a cathedral in medieval England, filled with political intrigue and romance.

The Help.author: Kathryn Stockett
The Help.description: Set in the 1960s South, this novel explores race relations through the eyes of Black maids and the women they serve.

A Game of Thrones.author: George R.R. Martin
A Game of Thrones.description: The first book in an epic fantasy series, filled with noble houses, dragons, and a fierce struggle for power.

The Shining.author: Stephen King
The Shining.description: A haunting tale of a mans descent into madness while isolated in a remote hotel with sinister forces at work.

Gone Girl.author: Gillian Flynn
Gone Girl.description: A psychological thriller about a marriage gone wrong, where nothing is as it seems.
